ProductOverview.Summary: Tamanu is a free and open-source, patient-level electronic health record (EHR) for desktop and mobile.
ProductOverview.Description: It allows health workers to track individual patients and provide clinical support. Designed specifically for remote settings and the Asia-Pacific context, Tamanu allows health workers to monitor patients in hospitals, health centers, clinics, and even out in the community, enabling consistent, long-term management of patient conditions. The system is offline-first, with syncing capabilities allowing users to work seamlessly with and without an internet connection. The mobile and desktop versions are fully integrated “out-of-the-box”, meaning there are no third-party integrations required for any core features.
ProductOverview.PrimaryFunctionality:
At the hospital level, Tamanu Desktop allows a full suite of functionality, including scheduling, admissions, medication orders, location (ward and bed), department management, lab integrations (via SENAITE/Tamanu Lab), discharges, and patient management (including treatment notes). The desktop application works offline, syncing with a central server whenever an internet connection becomes available.

At the clinic level, Tamanu Mobile offers functionality to capture diagnoses, treatments, vitals, and the recording of events such as births, ante-natal visits, and deaths. It also contains a comprehensive immunization register that includes clinical decision support.   The platform can host a patient master index (PMI) or pull patient identifiers from an external PMI. It also supports integration with laboratory and radiology information management systems via an HL7 FHIR compliant API.
ProductOverview.Users:
- Frontline healthcare workers who use Tamanu to record clinical patient information, enabling consistent and long-term management of patients.
- Hospital and clinic administrative staff who use Tamanu to support the management of patient records, personal information, clinical coding, and billing.
- Bilateral partners and donors who use Tamanu for reporting purposes.

Reach.SummaryOfReach: Tamanu has specifically been designed for remote settings and the Asia-Pacific context. The adoption of Tamanu within the Asia-Pacific has expanded over the years, with many health clinics and also major hospitals now using our solution. Tamanu Mobile is also being used by various ministries of health around the Asia-Pacific to assist in conducting screenings of non-communicable diseases, mass drug administrations, and other significant vertical health programs.

en.formal: the Independent State of Papua New Guinea

Maturity.SummaryOfMaturity: All maturity model assessments are self-reported by the funded organization leading the development of the global good.  The scores for Inclusive Design, Climate Resilience and Low Carbon are not available as this assessment was done using the previous version of the maturity model.

Sustainability.Description: BES pride themselves on maintaining a stable business model of profitable sustainability, where the primary goal is to help people and not simply to derive profits. All software created by BES, including Tamanu, has been built on free and open-source platforms, meaning the software code is publicly accessible and can be managed or modified by adequately equipped local ICT staff should they wish or need to do so.
